content.webTitle: Football: Ferguson to blame for Van Nistelrooy exit

fields.headline: Ferguson to blame
fields.bodyText: Ruud van Nistelrooy signed a three-year contract with Real Madrid at the Bernabéu last night and revealed that the breakdown of his relationship with Sir Alex Ferguson was the reason behind his £10.25m transfer from Manchester United. "My relationship with Ferguson had ended, which was very painful," he said. His omission from the team for the League Cup final in March had been the final straw, he confirmed. "What happened, happened. It was very disappointing for me." But at least the Dutch striker now has the opportunity to link up again with David Beckham, another casualty of Ferguson's ire. "I missed him," he said after posing for photographers. Madrid's president Ramón Calderón welcomed the man he called "the goal machine", who signed a £3.4m per year contract.
